CODIF_DATA.AA_AUTHORITY_TYPE: Ministry or any other national or federal authority
CODIF_DATA.RP_REGULATION: European Economic Area (EEA), with participation by GPA countries
CODIF_DATA.HEADING: 03C02

TI_TEXT.P: Rådgivning inden for ingeniørvæsen og byggeri
Υπηρεσίες παροχής συμβουλών σε θέματα μηχανικής και κατασκευών
Servicios de consultoría en ingeniería y construcción
Services de conseil en matière d'ingénierie et de construction
Savjetodavne tehničke usluge i savjetodavne usluge u građevinarstvu
Servizi di consulenza ingegneristica e di costruzione
Servizzi ta' konsulenza dwar l-inġinerija u l-kostruzzjoni
Serviços de consultoria em matéria de engenharia e construção
Servicii de consultanţă în domeniul ingineriei şi al construcţiilor

SHORT_DESCR.P: The aim of the procurement is to establish several parallel framework agreements for technical support for 7 different disciplines.
Parallel framework agreements will be signed with 2 to 3 tenderers per framework agreement discipline, provided that there is a sufficient number of suitable tenderers.
Tenderers can submit a tender for 1, several or all of the framework agreements. The contracting authority will carry out separate evaluations for each framework agreement.
The framework agreement disciplines:
1) Project management and project planning;
2) Technical support;
3) Impact assessments and planning and development cases for construction projects;
4) Establishment of prerequisites and handling requirements within NND's areas of responsibility;
5) Establish processes and facilities for secure waste management and storing used fuel;
6) Planning and implementing decommissioning;
7) Operation and preparations for the 'Safe Enclosure' of KLDRA.
The technical support will consist of both shorter and longer assignments and will be connected to assignments with varying complexity and scope.
Support for the development and implementation of assignments.
Connected to project management and planning for the implementation of projects and other assignments within NND's areas of responsibility.
NND expects to require assistance for, amongst other things, the following assignments:
— project management and project planning.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Technical support for the implementation of projects and other assignments within NND's areas of responsibility.
NND expects to require assistance for, amongst other things, the following assignments:
— technical drawings and 3D scanning/modelling,
— technical impact assessments and strength calculations.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

TITLE.P: Impact Assessments and Planning and Development Cases for Construction Projects

SHORT_DESCR.P: Support for the development and implementation of assignments.
Connected to impact assessments and planning and development cases for construction projects and other assignments within NND's areas of responsibility.
NND expects to require assistance for, amongst other things, the following assignments:
— impact assessments in accordance with the Planning and Building Act,
— planning development and construction applications.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

TITLE.P: Establishment of Prerequisites and Management of Requirements within NND's Areas of Responsibility

SHORT_DESCR.P: Support for the development and implementation of assignments.
Connected to the establishment of prerequisites and the management of technical requirements within NND's areas of responsibility.
NND must handle, amongst other things, the following processes:
— establish acceptance criteria for free classification and define the final condition of the nuclear areas ('end state') in dialogue with the authorities,
— establish acceptance criteria for all radioactive waste and used fuel, based on the waste facilities' Safety Case,
— develop a safety case for the establishment of new nuclear sites or comprehensive modifications, such as planning for decommissioning,
— carry out risk and safety analyses at new and existing facilities, as part of the conditions that apply for the design/operation of the facility,
— develop requirements for waste packages that have suitable technical barriers and principles, based on an ALARA perspective and use of the best available technology (BAT),
— carry out environmental mappings of the facilities in Halden and Kjeller, for input for an environmental impact analysis (EIA).
In order to meet the needs in the above bullet points, NND needs assistance for the following areas:
— assistance in establishing waste acceptane criteria (WAC),
— assistance for nuclear risk and safety analyses, as well as reviews of ALARA systems,
— consultancy services within the establishment and operation of nuclear facilities,
— consultancy services within the transport/export of radioactive waste and used fuel,
— assistance for an environmental mapping of nuclear areas.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

TITLE.P: Establish Processes and Facilities for Secure Waste Management and the Storage of Used Fuel

SHORT_DESCR.P: Support for the development and implementation of assignments connected to the secure management of radioactive waste and the storage of used fuel.
NND must handle the following processes:
— learn from the experiences of international recommendations/'Best Practice', 'sister companies', with guidance from national authorities,
— develop processes, methods and quality assurance for waste segregation, waste management and storage, in accordance with the waste acceptance criteria ('WAC') for radioactive waste and used fuel,
— establish equipment, instrumentation and facilities for waste characterisation and control measurements,
— establish procedures and systems to ensure full control of the waste processes (physical protection, databases, emissions and dose contribution),
— establish waste facilities with the capacity for free classification, sorting, waste management, and measuring waste packages,
— production of waste packages within the acceptance criteria ('WAC'), which include the approval criteria ('RAC') for waste for final disposal or temporary storage,
— establish facilities for secure temporary storage of decommissioned waste,
— transfer used fuel to containers for secure temporary storage of used fuel,

— establish logistics, buffer areas and transport routes that ensure secure movement and storage of materials (including production of the vehicles, containers, waste packages). The use of the facility and resources must minimise the need for buffer storage and untreated waste,
— plan activities in the correct order so as to optimise waste flows and implement robust processes.
In order to meet the needs in the above bullet points, NND needs assistance for the following areas:
— consultancy services within licensing and the operation of the waste facility for the treatment and storage of radioactive waste and used fuel,
— radiation protection services, measurements and analyses,
— calculations, fixtures, updating fuel status (e.g., criticality calculations),
— design, facility modifications and construction,
— engineering design services for new nuclear facilities and new equipment,
— application for concession for new nuclear facilities,
— assistance with the characterisation of radioactive waste and used fuel,
— consultancy services within radioactive transport and waste logisitics.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

SHORT_DESCR.P: Support for the development and implementation of assignments.
Connected to decommissioning, waste minimisation and logistics.
NND must handle the following processes:

— planning for decommissioning based on an initial radiological characterisation (for example, define the free classification criteria for materials, buildings, and land, optimisation of waste management and free classification processes, planning for disassembly and demolition, implementation of decontamination measures, evaluation of data and conclusions, formulate plans and detailed planning),

— develop processes, methods and quality assurance for decommissioning, with safety as the first priority and with the prerequisite that all work must be carried out in accordance with strict SHA requirements,

— establish a system, in the form of a joint database, for the management and connection of updated site documentation with other relevant information for decommissioning (waste management, results from radiological mapping, 3D scans/modelling, etc.),

— identify needs for buildings, systems and equipment (for example, heating, cooling, ventilation water, electricity, pressurised air and lifting devices), which must be maintained during the decommissioning phases,
— learn from experience from international recommendations/‘Best Practice’, 'sister companies' and with guidance from national authorities.
In order to meet the needs in the above bullet points, NND needs assistance for the following areas:
— radiological mapping of facilities and the surrounding environment,
— modelling and spreading calculations of radioactivity in the surrounding area,
— advice and assistance within practical radiation protection work,
— advice and assistance within decontamination of systems, facilities and areas,
— advice and assistance with the disassembly and demolition of nuclear facilities.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

TITLE.P: Operation and Preparation for the 'Safe Enclosure' of KLDRA Himdalen

SHORT_DESCR.P: Support for the operation of KLDRA Himdalen and preparations for the Safe Enclosure' connected to the disposal of radioactive waste.

The amount of waste from the decommissioning will exceed the remaining capacity in KLDRA Himdalen well before the decommissioning work is completed. KLDRA Himdalen must therefore be operated and completed in the period.
NND must handle the following processes:

— ensure the operation of temporary storage and disposal of radioactive waste in the Himdalen facility from IFE nuclear facilities and external customers (medical screening and treatment, industry and agriculture, scientific and industrial research),
— establish processes and preparations for the certification of 'Safe Enclosure' for KLDRA-Himdalen.
In order to meet the needs in the above bullet points, NND needs assistance for the following areas:
— consultancy services within licensing the planning for 'Safe Enclosure',
— modelling and spreading calculations in order to ensure the baseline of radioactivity in the surrounding area,
— consultancy services within the operation of disposal facilities for radioactive waste,
— consultancy services within the transport and disposal of radioactive waste.

RENEWAL_DESCR.P: Option for an additional 2 years, with up to 1 year at a time.

SUITABILITY.P: Overview and short description of the terms: tenderers shall be a legally established company.

ECONOMIC_FINANCIAL_INFO.P: An overview and brief description of the qualification requirements:

TECHNICAL_PROFESSIONAL_INFO.P: An overview and brief description of the qualification requirements:
— the tenderer shall have adequate experience from equivalent contracts,
— the tenderer must have the necessary capacity and competence to implement the contract,
— the tenderer must have a good and well-functioning quality assurance system.
